node.title: EQC grants $1m in funding for research into natural hazard resilience
node.description: Thirteen researchers have been granted $1 million to boost New Zealand's resilience to natural hazards.

node.title: Transport Accident Commission recommends additional safety compliance for roadworks
node.description: An investigation into a fatal 2019 accident between a car and a train has found the roadworks contractor failed to ask for permission to work in the rail corridor.

node.title: Fears Porirua parking meters will drive people out of the city centre
node.description: The Porirua Chamber of Commerce says proposed parking meters in the CBD will pile more pressure on businesses, and price out people from the city centre.

node.title: High School Baseball Star Transfers After Assistant Athletic Director Made 'Racist' Joke
node.description: The school stated that the coach in question had resigned from his position.

node.title: Experts Think Plea Deal Possible For Man Who Killed 6 When Driving SUV Into Waukesha Parade
node.description: Darrell Brooks Jr. is charged five counts of first-degree intentional homicide, a total expected to increase to six after another victim died Tuesday.

node.title: Genesis of the Canberra artist who just took out four ARIA awards
node.description: Canberra is known for many things — mostly politicians and public servants. But it's also home to a growing music scene, and one of its members just took out four ARIA awards.

node.title: Woolworths lifts homebrand milk price, dairy farmers hope others will follow
node.description: Consumers can expect to pay more for homebrand milk in Woolworths from today after the retail giant announces a small increase.

node.title: Judith Collins steps down as National Party leader
node.description: Dr Shane Reti is interim leader of the National Party after Judith Collins lost a no-confidence vote.

node.title: South Canterbury latest DHB to reach 90pc first doses
node.description: South Canterbury has become the latest district health board to pass 90 percent first doses for the Covid-19 vaccine.

node.title: Theft of bonsai trees: It's like 'loss of irreplaceable art', police say
node.description: Police are appealing for the public's help after the theft of 45 bonsai trees from a property in Mt Albert in Auckland.

node.title: Spending Is Up, Jobless Claims Are Down, But Confidence in US Economy Remains Iffy
node.description: A 1.3 percent rise in consumer spending in October in the face of rising inflation gave experts a positive sign in new economic data released Wednesday.

node.title: Road worker Des Carr vanished 40 years ago. An inquest hears the search may have been bungled
node.description: A family member of a road worker who disappeared more than 40 years ago in the Kimberley has expressed his dismay after an inquest raised the possibility the initial search was bungled.

node.title: Death warrant signed for thousands of brumbies as Kosciuszko plan finalised
node.description: Conservationists are welcoming a move to try and reduce the park's feral horse population by about 75 per cent over the next six years, but say the numbers should never have been allowed to rise so high.

node.title: 'It must be a crushing blow to be sent to prison at 63 years of age': Woman jailed for deceiving millions from employer
node.description: A senior accounts manager at Adelaide Brighton who deceived her employer out of $12 million to benefit a customer had falsified documents at a previous employer, a court is told.

node.title: FedEx Investigates After Hundreds of Packages Found in Alabama Ravine
node.description: FedEx has struggled with hiring workers and rerouting packages to ensure timely delivery during the busy holiday season.

node.title: At Last Minute, Kanye West, Taylor Swift Added as Top Grammy Nominees
node.description: Abba, Lil Nas X and others benefited as the number of competitors in the four all-genre categories grew from eight to 10 in a meeting the day before the nominations were announced.

node.title: Three men are found guilty of murder in Arbery shooting.
node.description: Three white men were found guilty of murder and other charges on Wednesday for the pursuit and fatal shooting of Ahmaud Arbery, a 25-year-old Black man.

node.title: School Board Meeting Ends Early When Parents Applaud Man's 'Racist' Comments
node.description: "This is horrible: teaching our kids about race, how to hate each other," the man said.

node.title: Donations Roll in For Man Left With 'Nothing' After His Wrongful Conviction Was Overturned
node.description: Kevin Strickland is not eligible for compensation from Missouri after his 42 years in prison because his conviction was not overturned with DNA evidence.

node.title: 8 Officers, Sergeant On Paid Administrative Leave After Man Hit With Stun Gun Twice Dies
node.description: While the Sonoma County Sheriff's Office's Facebook post gave details about the Nov. 18 incident, the officers who used their stun guns were not identified.

node.title: What do China and Taiwan have to do with violent protests in Solomon Islands?
node.description: Violent protests in Honiara saw buildings go up in flames and calls for the Prime Minister to resign. But what does this have to do with China and Taiwan?

node.title: 'Throughout this pandemic one of the hardest things to do has been to plan' - PM
node.description: Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern says the focus now is on getting New Zealand's new Covid protection settings right domestically. Video

node.title: NZSIS' advisory role on immigration security risks to be clarified
node.description: The Inspector-General of Intelligence and Security has recommended improvements to New Zealand's approach to screening visa applications for security risk.

node.title: 'Catastrophic event': Police seize cache of guns, bombs from property on Sydney's outskirts
node.description: Police say a doomsday prepper who allegedly amassed dozens of guns and 250kg of explosive material at his home on Sydney's outskirts put the community at risk of a "catastrophic event".

node.title: Three white men convicted of murdering Ahmaud Arbery in Georgia
node.description: Three white men have been convicted of murder for chasing and shooting a Black man named Ahmaud Arbery as he ran in their neighbourhood.

node.title: Guilty, Guilty, Guilty
node.description: This was a reminder that the lives of Black people are valued in this country — at least on occasion.

node.title: Former Army Officer Who Wrote John McCain About Prisoner Abuse by US Soldiers Dies
node.description: "...I have been unable to get clear, consistent answers from my leadership about what constitutes lawful and humane treatment of detainees," Ian Fishback wrote.

node.title: Activists charged after 12-hour protest against Woodside gas project
node.description: Police say the demonstration against the $16 billion Scarborough project endangered the public and drained their resources.

node.title: Review of ballistics evidence ordered 25 years after Jeffery Brooks was shot dead
node.description: NSW Police will review ballistics evidence more than 25 years after the 24-year-old was shot dead on a farm south of Brisbane, as an inquest investigates who pulled the trigger.

node.title: 'I'm sure there will be controversy': World Rugby opens the door for Israel Folau to switch to Tonga
node.description: Sacked Wallaby Israel Folau could make the switch to Tonga after World Rugby changed its eligibility requirements, with head coach Toutai Kefu saying the pair have spoken about it.
